programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer is furious when Seth rumbles him for trying to flog fake goods. Later, panic grips the staff as a farmer lets an animal loose in the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1951 Willys Wagon gathers interest when it pulls into the shop. Rick is also intrigued by a pair of 19th-century European swords.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed first edition of The Wonderful Wizard of Oz is brought into the shop and Corey races to check out a one-of-a-kind Turbo Drive II arcade game.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz take their nephew on his first pick and visit the 1890s home that once belonged to an opera singer.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters enter new territory in search of alligators, with one team waging war against a bait-thieving beast and another hunting with a motorbike and sidecar.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A freak downpour leaves the roads covered in a thick layer of ice. Ken Monkhouse relives a terrible past experience as he braves the conditions to drive up a remote hill.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi bids for an expensive locker, not knowing what it contains, while Darrell Sheets returns to town with money to burn.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Bold buyers Brandi, Jarrod, Barry and Dave smoke out the competition with their sharp eyes in California. But who will buy trash and who will find treasure?.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More 2018 News for You
programme.desc: An extended compilation of the most memorable news stories of 2018, with captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop, and assorted hosts and special guests from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former Happy Mondays frontman Shaun Ryder, comedian and actress Meera Syal and Australian stand-up Sam Simmons tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include football talk, boisterous whistling and severe makeover shows.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Mancunian stand-up Jason Manford hosts the comedy show from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, and invites observational comic Michael McIntyre to take to the stage.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian continues to sample a wide variety of jobs, this week donning make-up and a dress to become a drag artist. Coached by one of the country's leading performers, he faces the daunting challenge of appearing on stage dressed as a woman in front of a packed audience.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear
programme.desc: Arkwright decides Granville needs toughening up and starts dragging him around the store by his ear, but the regular customers are unhappy by what they see.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Unearthing WWII
programme.desc: Historian David O'Keefe and filmmaker Wayne Abbott explore battlefields to investigate unsolved mysteries, beginning with one of the sites of the Normandy Landings.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team takes on three cases at once in-between major murder investigations. Harry deals with a hit-and-run on a council estate, Leo investigates the cause of a fire that left a woman dead, and Nikki is called out when a bride-to-be collapses and dies on her hen night. Starring Tom Ward, William Gaminara and Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The arrival of strict new sergeant-major Alan Fitzpatrick causes quite a stir among the ranks, while memories of traumatic episode from Hobbs' past come flooding back during an exercise, threatening his chances of promotion. The boys persuade a reluctant Butcher to invest in a greyhound and the wives reveal their competitive side while organising a charity auction.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Personal problems are high on the troops' agenda as Andy Butcher's mother throws his love life into disarray, Angela McCleod's house is broken into and Sergeant-Major Alan Fitzpatrick learns he cannot treat his daughter like a private on parade.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill relief bid a final farewell to murdered colleague Lance Powell and Adam Okaro's funeral address is all the more moving for a spell on the beat alongside Laura Bryant. Nadir and Sim investigate a well known footballer accused of rape and discover he has form - as does the witness who gave his name to the police. A routine drugs bust turns into a free-for-all when the dealer's henchmen turn up in numbers at the critical moment.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna hands in her notice, but insists that the lottery win has not changed her. Sam tells Jade everything will work out, oblivious to the gossip going around the hospital. Meanwhile, Matt ignores Dean's advice and goes out for a drink with Nikki after the pair meet when he treats her sick father.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Patrick has little time for celebration when Duffy takes her maternity leave, especially once a retired doctor arrives at the hospital and starts putting him through his paces. Medical drama, guest starring Frank Thornton, with Ian Kelsey and Cathy Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New boy PC Will Fletcher (Gary Lucy) gets off to a bad start at Sun Hill as he's stopped for speeding on the way, reprimanded for being late and put in his place for an inappropriate remark about a member of the public. He starts to feel more at home after a successful operation and a wind-up by Smithy and Tony Stamp. Things start to turn sour for Terry Perkins when he visits his brother in prison.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: After another exam Michelle finds unexpected help in getting to Pete's inquest, whilst Kathy leaves Natalie and Bianca in charge of the cafe - with chaotic results.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil decides it's time to sort Jimmy out. Alan wants to take more responsibility for his grandmother, but Carol isn't too happy about it.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A huge blaze in a bus depot gives Blue Watch one of their toughest challenges. Carole gets some good news about her future.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Alice appears in court for non-payment of council tax, a teenager asks Jack for tranquilisers, and interviews are held for the post of fund manager. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Jack Clayton (ex-Emmerdale actor Ian Kelsey) and his family visit Skelthwaite, the home town of his wife Nisha (former Coronation Street actress Shobna Gulati), who happens to be a nurse - handy for Anna, who is struggling to replace Kim. David doesn't feel like celebrating his birthday as the factory's problems reach crisis point, and Zoe becomes suspicious of a patient's boyfriend.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The girls' aunt is taken to hospital with a broken leg, and it's up to them to decide whether she goes to an old people's home or comes to stay at their house. Comedy, starring Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey relishes her role as country commissioner for the Girl Guides when she reprimands Richard for not sponsoring a fundraising event in aid of a new scout hut. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The wily trio set about trying to find a new home for Smiler, whose wife has left him after 33 years of marriage and gone to live with her sister in Australia.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo is very upset to learn that that Nora Batty has taken Smiler as a lodger, so Foggy attempts to distract him from his depression by indulging in a spot of dancing. Brian Wilde and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A black man is murdered in a jail cell by a confirmed racist - a crime the prison service blames on overcrowding. However, the judge's probing reveals the institution wasn't operating at full capacity. A drink-driving appeal puts the bench at loggerheads, and Jo distances herself from her former lover. With Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Charlie is appointed to defend an animal rights activist accused of murdering an eminent scientist - a case that will be heard before her father. The defence barrister's support for her client's cause leads her to make a series of unprofessional outbursts in court, while Jo's relationship with Marc Thompson creates tension.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. The prime suspects are her fellow quiz team-mates, who won their lucky windfall as part of a syndicate, and while some have put their money to good use, the victim's boyfriend has fallen on hard times and the media remain convinced he is the key to her murder. As allegations of affairs, fights and betrayal begin to surface, the team is left to ponder whether money really is the root of all evil.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry's burgeoning relationship with Nikki is jeopardised when his former girlfriend Penny is killed in a car crash. It looks like suicide at first glance, but DCI Ambrose uncovers evidence that the victim may have had an affair - as well as a secret child. Meanwhile, Leo examines the staged death of a conceptual artist.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: Jean-Christophe Novelli is this week's guest judge on the cookery competition, with nine more contestants battling it out today for the £1,000 cash prize. The first challenge is designed to test the participants' knife skills with ginger, then six go on to prepare a ribeye steak before the final three create the ultimate steak dish. Fern Britton hosts.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Freddie Fox talks about new thriller film Fanny Lyre.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Buxton, Derbyshire. A collection of cartoon maps brought to Henry Nicholls' table surprises everybody at the auction, and Tim Hogarth buys a mint condition Winnie the Pooh first edition book. Plus, dealer Jan Keyne can't stop dancing when she hears the sound of a 1950s radio.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of British Army colleagues attempts to topple the Tenable Tower of 10 to win a big cash prize. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ben, Clive, Danielle and Hope pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP is perturbed when he discovers Louisa, who is already spending much of her time away from home, has applied to take up a child and adolescent counselling course. However, achieving a work-life balance is far from the greatest of concerns for some of the Ellinghams' neighbours, not least of whom is Al, whose plans to demonstrate his business acumen are placed in jeopardy when Ken decides to close the pub. Unless Ruth agrees to serve as a guarantor, Ken will not allow Morwenna and Al to take over the establishment, so the pair arrange a race-walking event to raise funds and prove the community is on their side.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts six more contestants through their paces to see who will have the opportunity to answer 15 questions to win the prize of £1,000,000. Each player has four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Alexander Armstrong's Land of the Midnight Sun
programme.desc: The presenter continues his epic 8,000-mile journey halfway around the Arctic Circle deep in mid-winter. On the third and final leg of his odyssey, he begins in Northern Canada before travelling into the icy wilderness of Alaska. Along the way, Alexander meets people who have headed north to discover adventure and seek their fortune, as well as digging for gold with modern day prospectors. He also takes on the challenge of driving up one of the deadliest roads in the world, before concluding his travels on the international dateline between America and Russia.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary camera footage, including a climber in Colorado who took a 40ft fall - with every terrifying moment captured on his bodycam - and a Northern Ireland family whose holiday to Greece was ruined by a freak storm. Also, the heart-warming story of a paralysed man who set a world record by walking a marathon, a Transport for London employee who came up with a knockout idea to liven up his station announcements and a Bristol couple who tried to free a trapped turtle in Oman.

programme.title: Ross Kemp Living With
programme.desc: The actor and documentary-maker continues his examination into the impact of dementia, meeting a family whose five-year-old girl has a form of the disease and a woman who needs to sell her mother's house to pay for her £70,000 annual care home fees. Ross also talks once more to Scott Mitchell, husband of his former colleague Barbara Windsor, to find out how they have been coping during lockdown.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Calvin Harris From The Start!
programme.desc: We are taking you on a musical journey with Calvin Harris from the start!.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: With a jam-packed farmhouse, killer barn, and rare rat rod Rolls Royce, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive Ohio collection has mega-pick potential.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Mikey Teutul and Vinnie DiMartino's favourite out-takes from the bike-building show, including Paul Teutul Sr's experience in a space suit and the team's drag racing exploits.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Two pilots manage to land a plane containing vaccines on one of Alaska's most treacherous runways, while Ariel Tweto takes to the skies - but still has a lot to learn.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe explores a cricket farm in Georgia and discovers how 25 million insects are managed. Later, he heads farther afield to talk about turkey with experts.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in the creation of motorcycles, clay pipes, drumsticks and whistles.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The technology involved in the production of handcuffs, propane tanks and caulking.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology that allows rescue workers to cut open a crushed car in a matter of seconds, and the techniques enabling parachutists to land with amazing precision on a target the size of a coin.

programme.title: History in the Making
programme.desc: Artisans restore Second World War rifle, the M1 Garand. Plus, they create barrels using traditional methods and American sports balls from the 19th century.

programme.title: History in the Making
programme.desc: Artisans forge the Greek hoplite soldier's breastplate. They also make a print using early industrial wood engraving and create a beaver fur top hat.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: King Crab season comes to an end and the fleet pull up their last pots. Rookie captain Jake Anderson struggles with the decision to leave the Northwestern. Documentary following life aboard ship in the Alaskan crab-fishing fleet.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate for a find, the Bushmen gamble on a dangerous mining method deep below ground. In Lightning Ridge an injury causes The Bros a serious setback.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Preston, a job centre is demolished and in Yeovil a 20ft yacht is ripped to pieces. Plus, in the Somerset village of Woolavington, a sculptor is on the hunt for scrap material.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Cadillac coupe with minimal rust and damage. However, the interior is a different story meaning Edd China faces a challenge to turn a profit on its renovation.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his client's rare 1908 Simplex Speedcar roadster to an auction to see what kind of money it will make.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini restores an AC Ace for a man who has bought it as a surprise for his father.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jimmy de Ville head to Korea to find out how it made world-beating cars in just a few years. Jimmy revisits the original Bentley Blower and Jason Plato hits the track in an Alpine A110

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate for a find, the Bushmen gamble on a dangerous mining method deep below ground. In Lightning Ridge an injury causes The Bros a serious setback.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Time Bandit crew races back to the dock after a freak accident - but faces falling behind the other teams.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a hot rod mechanic with a super expensive collection of rare bubbletop cars.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Monmouthshire at the UK's largest stockist of antique railwayana, modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard spots some amazing wagon signage. In Gloucestershire he finds a stunning Victorian card table.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Oldham, a magistrates' court is torn down. Plus, in Halifax car brake discs are given new life and in Wokingham an old horse transporter reaches the end of the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns' claim is ravaged by a vast dust storm. Meanwhile, the Boulder Boys chase old leads and the Bushmen face a disaster fifteen metres underground.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard heads to Petworth in West Sussex - the antiques capital of the south of England. He also bids on an unusual fire screen in Lancashire.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: Troublesome Welsh weather hampers the arrival of a Boeing 737 coming in from Scandinavia, and the team faces a race against time to strip and ship the plane's valuable engines.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: Customs agents are keen to get hold of a prized work of art to check for suspect packages within. Border police give chase to cannabis smugglers on the beaches of La Linea.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: A Spanish driver returns from Tangiers driving a banned car. A Madrid Airport a hairy discovery in a passenger's suitcase arouses suspicion.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into how people care for bees, plus a look at how to build a trike that can carry a whole family and how to stop a bullet with a sheet of ceramic.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into how the minerals that are an essential ingredient in glass cookware are mined, and a look at how money is kept safe and secure inside cash machines.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to double his money by working with expert mechanic Edd China to turn an Austin-Healey Frogeye Sprite into a quality classic car. Once completed, the duo test-drive it around the Brooklands Motor Museum in Surrey, prior to selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How DNA testing can clear innocent suspects, even when all the circumstantial evidence points to their guilt.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of student Kenia Monge, who disappeared without a trace. The search hit dead ends until detectives uncovered chilling surveillance footage, revealing what had befallen her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The deaths of Alabama country store owner Billy Triplett and his wife Debbie in June 2001. Locals suspected their fate must have been connected with his illegal side-business of retailing alcohol. However, when word of a bloodstained stash of money reached investigators, they were shocked to realise the identity of the person wishing to conceal it.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI are called in when a bank manager is unable to open the vault, revealing a sophisticated burglary with losses of $8million.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for a Dogfight Kingpin
programme.desc: Two abused pit bulls are seized from dog fighters, 16 feral cats are rescued from an abandoned house and a lost bird is returned home.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori steps in when a bride's sorority sisters gang up on her other friend. Plus, sisters who are both getting married fight over the same dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Featuring a woman who is getting married on the stage at a concert, and a virgin bride visiting the salon for the first time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country music star Angaleena Presley struggles to make her voice heard as she shops for a wedding dress with her bandmates.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Armed with 800 euros, three rivals take on the flea market in Villeurbanne in Lyon's suburbs. They put their own stamp on purchases before heading to Norwich to sell it all. Steph transforms a table with wallpaper decoupage, Leah shows that she's the queen of shabby chic, ehile Darren blow-dries a taxidermy badger.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: As Hurricane Rita destroyed huge areas of Texas, the SPCA officers worked around the clock to organise a huge animal rescue operation.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators set out on a daring mission to rescue 11 bears and two tigers from cruelty.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three cases in which investigators had to apply their extensive expertise to apprehend murderers who had killed for money.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of millionaire Bob Harrod, who finally married his childhood sweetheart Fontelle at the age of 81. While she was making preparations to move from Missouri to join her new husband at his California house in July 2009, he vanished from outside the property, and though his car keys were taken the vehicle itself remained in the drive.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Hatice Corbacioglu, who vanished in June 2009 while visiting lover Riza Cosa in New York. The plot thickened when Cosa fled to his native Turkey and the body of his wife was was found stuffed in a bag in a New York steel factory where he had worked. A year later, in an apparent suicide, Cosa fell to his death from a tall building,.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The murder of 47-year-old Miriam Illes, who was shot through her kitchen window in January 1999. Her estranged husband Richard had a strong alibi, but suspicions remained and prints found in the snow from basketball shoes proved damning.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'm Not the Size of a Hanger!
programme.desc: A bride prepares for a beer-themed wedding, while a customer seeks the help of her friends in choosing a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The wedding guru herself, Martha Stewart, visits Kleinfeld, hoping to help bride Bailey choose her perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Randy has a surprise in store for a military veteran planning her wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Joelle tries on her mother's dress from the 1980s, and another customer declares herself the anti-bride.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Paralympic athlete Amy Purdy isn't afraid to take risks, such as waiting to find her dress just three weeks before the big day. Plus, Lori's wedding is just nine days ahead.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Not Afraid to Try New Things
programme.desc: Excited wedding planner Rachel tries on some 'edgy' dresses. Natalie wants a unique gown, but knows her traditionally minded mother may not approve. Kleinfeld employee Subrina hopes her customised dress will match her vision.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: Do I Call Him My Son?
programme.desc: A woman searches for her brother, hoping to fulfil a promise she made to her late mother. Her discovery blows open a 40-year-old family secret.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Benji fears he will suffer the same fate as older brother David, who is now 700lbs. They embark on their weight loss journey together.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.sub-title: The Kings: The Moment of Truth
programme.desc: Casey finds out if he has been approved for life-saving surgery. Meanwhile, Amanda has huge news about her cancer, and Amy attempts a hellish Spartan Race.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A woman who is missing 19 teeth feels her problem is totally out of her control and seeks help from psychotherapist Dr Linda Papadopoulos.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A look back at some of the best stories reported in the first series, finding out how the participant's surgical and psychological transformations have since changed their lives for ever.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of a hunting accident that turned into a murder-for-hire plot when a tip linked a teen's murder to a man who killed his friends for a fee.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic artists use the remains of unknown victims to draw conclusions which enable police to identify the body and begin a murder investigation.
